Greetings. I am <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 9)>, Campaign Arbiter for the Allied Forces.<Prompt>
What can I help you with. <Selection Dialog>Nothing. Performance assessment. New Allied Tags. Temporary items. Union registration. Teleportation. Information on the Allied Campaign.<Prompt>
What would you like to know. <Selection Dialog>Nothing. I'm sorry. About performance assessment. About Allied Tags. About temporary items. About Unions.<Prompt>
I am sorry, but at this time, I cannot be of any assistance in that area.<Prompt>
Understood. I shall now judge your performance and award the proper remuneration.<Prompt>
Ah, I'm sorry to inform you that your performance has not earned you any compensation.<Prompt>
Understood. I shall prepare a new set of tags for you now.<Prompt>

You've already undergone an evaluation for this battle, or had you forgotten. As much as I'd like to, I'm forbidden from providing you with a new set of Allied Taegs until the next battle begins.<Prompt>
Anyone wearing Allied Tags while participating in a campaign battle will be judged on their overall performance.<Prompt>
Soldiers will be evaluated not only on their fighting skills, but also on how much they contribute to the efforts of their allies through means such as healing and enhancing.<Prompt>
However, beware that if you leave the area before being assessed, you will be deemed a deserter and will forfeit all rewards earned that day.<Prompt>
Also, while there are no immediate penalties for being knocked out, falling in battle will significantly lower the score given to you.<Prompt>
When you are ready to receive compensation for your work on the field, return to me and I shall assess your performance and provide you with your payment.<Prompt>
Allied Tags are a special type of identification given to all participants of Allied Campaign battles.<Prompt>
There are benefits, as well as drawbacks, to wearing the tags. One of the benefits is that in the case you are knocked out on the battlefield, you will not lose any experience points.<Prompt>
However, some of the drawbacks include the inability to improve skills and earn experience points for individual kills, as well as the right to loot fallen enemies.<Prompt>
Temporary items can be purchased in exchange for Allied Notes.<Prompt>
There are several different varieties of items, but they all have one thing in common--they can only be used on the battlefield they were issued.<Prompt>
It is highly recommended that you first survey a battle's conditions and then select the supplies that you believe will benefit you most.<Prompt>
Please remember that all temporary items you carry on your person will be confiscated in the event that you leave the area.<Prompt>
You can only purchase temporary items if your nation of allegiance is commanding the campaign.<Prompt>
That is all.<Prompt>

Oh ho! Keen to join a Union, are we. Very well. Listen up and I shall tell you all you need to know.<Prompt>

In order to better coordinate Allied efforts against the beastman menace, we have instituted a system of ad hoc tactical regiments called  Unions.  With five units to a battlefield, union registration is open to any proven soldier in possession of Allied Tags.<Prompt>
In return for their aid in advancing the war effort, union registrants will be eligible to earn a share of the spoils of war.<Prompt>

Needless to say, the choicest rewards will be reserved for those unions which make the greatest contributions in combat. Prove your mettle on the field of battle, and you will earn glory for your union, as well as a sizable bounty of your own.<Prompt>

Be forewarned that your commitment to your union comes first and foremost. In the aftermath of battle, you will not be permitted to reap rewards from your individual exploits until your union has distributed its plunder.<Prompt>

The adorable little Tarutaru with the blonde braids is laying plaster. Gonna have to get her on some ice crystals.<Prompt>

The good-looking fella in all white does scaffoldin'. Young Hume lad. See to it he's usin' light crystals.<Prompt>
The lady Elvaan's a painter. Handles a brush like nobody I never seen. Need dark crystals in that line of work. And that's it.<Prompt>

Read up on what. <Selection Dialog>Nothing for now. Voidwatch Ops. How to participate. <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>5  . Stratum abyssite. Alignment. Atmacite. Periapt.<Prompt>

The Voidwatch is a fellowship of men and women come together to defend the world from extradimensional invaders called  Voidwalkers.  Driven only by an insatiable appetite for destruction, these fell horrors roam the space between dimensions, ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.<Prompt>

Faced with the risk of mass invasion, Voidwatch leaders devised a strategy wherein potential threats are preemptively neutralized. This act was made possible through the discovery of voidstones, magicked objects capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible to be summarily dispatched.<Prompt>
Such efforts to stem the rise of Voidwalkers, collectively dubbed  Voidwatch Operations,  or  Ops  for short, take place in the vicinity of planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space.<Prompt>

A single person may initiate a Voidwatch operation, at which time  Voidwatcher  status will be bestowed upon all qualifying party and alliance members, allowing them to commence battle with the target Voidwalker.<Prompt>

Voidwatch Ops are subject to a time limit. Exceed this limit and Voidwatcher status will be revoked for all involved, bringing the confrontation to an end. Individuals straying too far from the site of battle, too, will find themselves relieved of the status.<Prompt>

Know also that those who take on the burden of the Voidwatcher become temporarily isolated and unable to receive aid from the outside world. Such is the arduous nature of transdimensional encounters.<Prompt>
Initiating a Voidwatch operation requires a voidstone, as well as a stratum abyssite attuned to a particular planar rift.<Prompt>
Only one person needs to be in possession of these objects for all party and alliance members to participate.<Prompt>
However, there exists a number of participation conditions that must be observed.<Prompt>

When an operation commences, a single voidstone will be expended for all who possess it. These combatants will have the opportunity to improve their spoils by manipulating spectral alignment values during battle.<Prompt>
Conversely, those not possessing their own voidstone will be limited in the spoils they can obtain.<Prompt>
The  voidstone  is a magicked object which, when coupled with stratum abyssite, is capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible.<Prompt>

Only a single combatant need possess a voidstone to allow all party and alliance members to participate in a Voidwatch operation. Those without one, however, will find their spoils limited in both quantity and quality.<Prompt>
As a single voidstone is automatically expended when the battle commences, it is recommended that you keep stock of your inventory.<Prompt>
Those wishing to obtain the stones should speak to a Voidwatch officer, who is charged with issuing a set quantity at fixed intervals.<Prompt>
Stratum abyssite are dynamic stones capable of evolution. By absorbing the energies emitted by felled Voidwalkers, they become attuned with other planar rifts.<Prompt>
After defeating your quarry, present your stone to an atmacite refiner--specialists in the study of otherworld geology--to have its properties determined.<Prompt>
Stratum abyssite growth occurs independently of voidstones, and the latter is not required to trigger development.<Prompt>

Each dimension is composed of its own existential spectrum to which objects of that world are aligned. The act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning oneself to its existential spectrum.<Prompt>

While Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with such creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.<Prompt>

Compensating measures, however, exist which allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe. One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as  ascent items. <Prompt>
Alignment values raised through ascent items will remain in place until such time as a riftworn pyxis is opened at the end of a successful operation.<Prompt>
Those participating in Voidwatch Ops are recommended to plan ahead in order to make effective use of ascent items.<Prompt>
Alignment values can also be raised in the midst of battle by striking at enemy weaknesses, causing their existential attunement to shift to your advantage.<Prompt>

Blows can be dealt with abilities such as weapon skills and magic spells, and your choice of weakness and the manner in which you strike it will determine which hue of the alignment spectrum is affected.<Prompt>
The existential spectrum is comprised of five lights (blue, red, yellow, green, and white), each of which influences reward yield.<Prompt>
The precise workings of each light can be reviewed when examining your current alignment values.<Prompt>
Upon the successful conclusion of battle, the alignment bonus as granted by ascent items and the exploitation of enemy weaknesses are combined to determine the spoils.<Prompt>

Be forewarned: Voidwalkers are highly guileful beings and will not suffer the same weakness being struck twice. Combatants must be on constant watch for any changes that may occur during the course of battle.<Prompt>

Atmacite is the physical agglomeration of a monster's soul, and a vessel for its feral instincts. By infusing atmacite to one's body using <Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 1)><Singular/Plural Choice (Parameter 5)>6  , it is possible to enhance one's battle prowess.<Prompt>
Be aware, however, that powers granted by atmacite can be tapped only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.<Prompt>
Atmacite is resilient and will not be expended in the infusion process.<Prompt>
Furthermore, infused atmacite will remain in place until voluntarily purged.<Prompt>
As the configuration of atmacite is not possible during an operation, be sure to see to your battle preparations ahead of time.<Prompt>
Cruor can be used to enrich atmacite, enhancing its potency. The amount of cruor required for enrichment and the resultant properties vary with atmacite.<Prompt>
Atmacite can be enriched in stages to a maximum of level <Numeric (Parameter 0)>.<Prompt>
All Voidwatchers are urged to make atmacite enrichment a priority, for they might just mean the difference between life and death.<Prompt>

Wait a moment... Could this be a result of the dimensional disturbance.<Prompt>
Oh, Goddess have mercy!<Prompt>

...<Prompt>

That is a dimensional disturbance. A rift in the fabric of space and time.<Prompt>
Whither it leads, we do not know. Haven't even a clue.<Prompt>
I made an attempt to venture beyond, but to no avail. My every effort thwarted.<Prompt>

Savage fiends, they are, and even more ill of temper after their transdimensional journey.<Prompt>

Different, you say.<Prompt>

A curious state, yes, but such is the nature of dimensional flux.<Prompt>
Parallel worlds--infinite possibilities that might have been, had things only happened differently. Taken another turn. From one such world do I hail.<Prompt>

I am myself, and no one else. Hence, there is nothing unusual about me.<Prompt>

If you'll excuse me for just a moment...<Prompt>
...It looks like we have a lot of catching up to do.<Prompt>

...<Prompt>

The fabric of time and space doth stretch and tear, the resultant holes ripping through worlds, eras, and realities with nary a care for their unfortunate denizens. Ever must we be vigilant against threats from beyond the void.<Prompt>
